availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Cumberland County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Son of Nancy Haggard. Farmer and magistrate in Burksville, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twelve enslaved persons in Burksville in 1850. Farmer and judge in Burksville in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Burksville in 1860. Household owned an additional eleven enslaved persons in Burksville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burksville, p. 279A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Burksville, District 2, p. 579.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District 2, p. 11.
Find A Grave, "Judge James O'Kelly Haggard (1811-1882)," Memorial #9030682, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9030682 (accessed December 8, 2020).
